review_title: Worked for this company for almost 5 years. Like most other companies, there are politics within the hierarchy.
pros: Health insurance is very reasonable and coverage is great. Working in an office which is not actually in the hospital is different. It would depend on which office you worked in that would help determine pros/cons. Fortunately I work in a great office.
cons: Company rarely gives a raise. I've been employed by SRPS for nearly 4 years and have received 1 small raise. Those who have been there more than 5 years tell me it's the first one they have received in years. No room for advancement.

review_title: Probably the same challenges as most acute care settings
pros: Close to home for me, free/convenient parking, opportunities for continuing education, average pay for local area
cons: Low salary compared to national average, little opportunity for advancement, recent acquisition by a large (for profit) corporation has benefited by providing updated equipment and small raises BUT small community team feel has been lost with employee and service terminations. Expensive, poor health benefits. Poor staffing ratios, example: critical care 1:3-4 at times. Medical 1:9-10 w minimal ancillary support.

pros: When we were Sharon Regional Health System all was great. When Community Health Systems bought us out it has been a nightmare. So many people lost their jobs and still are today. I'm still here because of loyalty to my office/friends.
cons: There's a lot of un reasonable surveys, education, etc. They ask for input and show us responses ( most of the employees share the same concerns) yet; they do nothing.All offices and the hospital are working on a skeleton crew.

review_title: Management is unorganized and play favorites with its employees.
job_title: Housekeeping Manager Supervisor in Sharon, PA
pros: The experience of working with all types of people. The service to the community and the knowledge that I was the best employee at my position.
cons: Management unorganized and they keep useless workers happy while the good employees are abused. Changed ownership too much causing a disruption in the way things were working.
